verses.verse: A Psalm of David. <S%H1732><s%> Plead <S%H7378><s%> my cause, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> with them that strive <S%H3401><s%> with me: fight <S%H3898><s%> against them that fight <S%H3898><s%> against me.
Take <S%H2388><s%> hold <S%H2388><s%> of shield <S%H4043><s%> and buckler, <S%H6793><s%> and stand <S%H6965><s%> up for my help. <S%H5833><s%>

Draw <S%H7324><s%> out also the spear, <S%H2595><s%> and stop <S%H5462><s%> the way against <S%H7125><s%> them that persecute <S%H7291><s%> me: say <S%H559><s%> to my soul, <S%H5315><s%> I am your salvation. <S%H3444><s%>

Let them be confounded <S%H954><s%> and put to shame <S%H3637><s%> that seek <S%H1245><s%> after my soul: <S%H5315><s%> let them be turned <S%H5472><s%> back <S%H268><s%> and brought <S%H2659><s%> to confusion <S%H2659><s%> that devise <S%H2803><s%> my hurt. <S%H7451><s%>
Let them be as chaff <S%H4671><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind: <S%H7307><s%> and let the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> chase <S%H1760><s%> them.
Let their way <S%H1870><s%> be dark <S%H2822><s%> and slippery: <S%H2519><s%> and let the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> persecute <S%H7291><s%> them.

For without <S%H2600><s%> cause <S%H2600><s%> have they hid <S%H2934><s%> for me their net <S%H7568><s%> in a pit, <S%H7845><s%> which without <S%H2600><s%> cause <S%H2600><s%> they have dig <S%H2658><s%> for my soul. <S%H5315><s%>

Let destruction <S%H7722><s%> come <S%H935><s%> on him at unawares; <S%H3045><s%> and let his net <S%H7568><s%> that he has hid <S%H2934><s%> catch <S%H3920><s%> himself: into that very destruction <S%H7722><s%> let him fall. <S%H5307><s%>
And my soul <S%H5315><s%> shall be joyful <S%H1523><s%> in the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> it shall rejoice <S%H7797><s%> in his salvation. <S%H3444><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> shall say, <S%H559><s%> LORD, <S%H3068><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> is like <S%H3644><s%> to you, which deliver <S%H5337><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> from him that is too strong <S%H2389><s%> for him, yes, the poor <S%H6041><s%> and the needy <S%H34><s%> from him that spoils <S%H1497><s%> him?
False <S%H2555><s%> witnesses <S%H5707><s%> did rise <S%H6965><s%> up; they laid to my charge <S%H7592><s%> things that I knew <S%H3045><s%> not.
They rewarded <S%H7999><s%> me evil <S%H7451><s%> for good <S%H2896><s%> to the spoiling <S%H7908><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>

But as for me, when they were sick, <S%H2470><s%> my clothing <S%H3830><s%> was sackcloth: <S%H8242><s%> I humbled <S%H6031><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> with fasting; <S%H6685><s%> and my prayer <S%H8605><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> into <S%H5921><s%> my own bosom. <S%H2436><s%>

I behaved <S%H1980><s%> myself as though he had been my friend <S%H7453><s%> or brother: <S%H251><s%> I bowed <S%H7817><s%> down <S%H7817><s%> heavily, <S%H6957><s%> as one that mourns <S%H57><s%> for his mother. <S%H517><s%>

But in my adversity <S%H6761><s%> they rejoiced, <S%H8055><s%> and gathered <S%H622><s%> themselves together: yes, the attackers <S%H5222><s%> gathered <S%H622><s%> themselves together against <S%H5921><s%> me, and I knew <S%H3045><s%> it not; they did tear <S%H7167><s%> me, and ceased <S%H1826><s%> not:
With hypocritical <S%H2611><s%> mockers <S%H3934><s%> in feasts, <S%H4580><s%> they gnashed <S%H2786><s%> on me with their teeth. <S%H8127><s%>

Lord, <S%H136><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you look <S%H7200><s%> on? rescue <S%H7725><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from their destructions, <S%H7722><s%> my darling <S%H3173><s%> from the lions. <S%H3715><s%>
I will give you thanks <S%H3034><s%> in the great <S%H7227><s%> congregation: <S%H6951><s%> I will praise <S%H1984><s%> you among much <S%H7227><s%> people. <S%H5971><s%>

Let not them that are my enemies <S%H341><s%> wrongfully <S%H8267><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me: neither let them wink <S%H7169><s%> with the eye <S%H5869><s%> that hate <S%H8130><s%> me without <S%H2600><s%> a cause. <S%H2600><s%>

For they speak <S%H1696><s%> not peace: <S%H7965><s%> but they devise <S%H2803><s%> deceitful <S%H4820><s%> matters <S%H1697><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them that are quiet <S%H7282><s%> in the land. <S%H776><s%>
Yes, they opened their mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide <S%H7337><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me, and said, <S%H559><s%> Aha, <S%H253><s%> aha, <S%H253><s%> our eye <S%H5869><s%> has seen <S%H7200><s%> it.
This <S%H2088><s%> you have seen, <S%H7200><s%> O LORD: <S%H3068><s%> keep not silence: <S%H2790><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> be not far <S%H7368><s%> from me.
Stir <S%H5782><s%> up yourself, and awake <S%H6974><s%> to my judgment, <S%H4941><s%> even to my cause, <S%H7379><s%> my God <S%H430><s%> and my Lord. <S%H136><s%>
Judge <S%H8199><s%> me, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> according to your righteousness; <S%H6664><s%> and let them not rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me.
Let them not say <S%H559><s%> in their hearts, <S%H3820><s%> Ah, <S%H253><s%> so would <S%H5315><s%> we have it: let them not say, <S%H559><s%> We have swallowed <S%H1104><s%> him up.

Let them be ashamed <S%H954><s%> and brought <S%H2659><s%> to confusion <S%H2659><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> that rejoice <S%H8055><s%> at my hurt: <S%H7451><s%> let them be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame <S%H1322><s%> and dishonor <S%H3639><s%> that magnify <S%H1431><s%> themselves against <S%H5921><s%> me.

Let them shout <S%H7442><s%> for joy, and be glad, <S%H8056><s%> that favor <S%H2655><s%> my righteous <S%H6664><s%> cause: yes, let them say <S%H559><s%> continually, <S%H8548><s%> Let the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be magnified, <S%H1431><s%> which has pleasure <S%H2655><s%> in the prosperity <S%H7965><s%> of his servant. <S%H5650><s%>
And my tongue <S%H3956><s%> shall speak <S%H1897><s%> of your righteousness <S%H6664><s%> and of your praise <S%H8416><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> long.
